title: Specialist Solutions Architect
content:
At NICE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Constantly. We’re relentless. We’re ambitious. And we make an impact. Our NICErs bring their A game and spend each day turning it into an A+. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the kind of challenge that will light a fire within you.Primary Responsibilities

Credibility: The Architect’s primary objective is to establish credibility for the Professional Services Group to the client.
Design: Lead multiple concurrent projects where both strategy and good tactical decision making are key. Design solutions to complex business problems by extending our proprietary software in ways that are supportable, upgradeable, maintainable and (ideally) would garner support across multiple customers.
Communicate: Champion the understanding, support for, and value of the architecture function and strategy, lead the architecture function including direct and indirect team members, and secure active participation and strong advocacy from the Business and IT communities, customers, suppliers, and industry bodies.

Detailed Responsibilities

Present the Actimize solutions to our customers in a post-sales role, creating credibility for the Professional Services
Lead the solution design effort on a variety of NICE Actimize customization projects
Design, review and document the on-site architecture of the NICE Actimize solutions, working together with the NICE Actimize implementation teams and the customer business and IT teams
Provide technical guidance and leadership to the project teams throughout all project phases, from planning to production deployment and beyond
Collaborate with product management on defining new product features
Create standard architecture documents, best practices and tools to be used by the professional services team in the various projects
Work with presales teams to design and present possible solutions to potential new customers, as well as help with RFI/RFP responses

 
Qualifications
Must have Experience in the following:

Current role and experience should be Solution Architect
Software Integration Solutions design
Customer exposure and handling and Technical Writing
In depth knowledge of Web architecture: web servers & application servers
Excellent knowledge of Database systems ( Oracle, MS-SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and performances
Knowledge of Core Java, AWS, SOAP, web services.
Understanding of emerging technologies and methodologies – Containerization, Kafka queue, Git repository , Jenkin
SSL, Authentication protocols : SSO, Kerberos etc
Designing for high availability systems
Customer facing experience, preferably in a Consulting or Professional Services capacity
Ability to learn new technologies very quickly and rapidly adapt to changing technology landscape
Consultative approach to problem solving
BE/Btech degree (advanced degree a plus) in Computer Science or related field and/or relevant experience of 10+ years of technical experience in a software industry.

Nice to have
Experience in the following:

Actimize customization/ Implementation– AML/FMC/Fraud product suit
Understanding of cSaaS and on-prim methodologies
Hardware sizing
System interfaces: web services, message queuing
Designing for high-volume scaling
System performance analysis and troubleshooting
Experience within the Financial Services industry a plus (banking, brokerage, or insurance)
About NICE 
NICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NICE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3+ billion financial transactions. 
Known as an innovation powerhouse that excels in AI, cloud and digital, NICE is consistently recognized as the market leader in its domains, with over 8,500 employees across 30+ countries. 
NICE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, neurotype, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.
